snippet: In time for the London Olympics the Tate Modern is expanding its exhibition and performance spaces.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Tate Modern museum in London is turning the oil tanks of a former power station into performance and exhibition spaces in preparation for the large crowds that the Olympic Games will bring; William-Adolphe Bouguereau’s painting Nymphs and Satyr will hang alongside Pierre Auguste Cot’s Springtime in an exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art; artist Trevor Paglen plans to launch a silicon wafer containing 100 photographs into earth's orbit for his project The Last Pictures.
lead_paragraph: In time for the London Olympics the Tate Modern is expanding its exhibition and performance spaces.

headline.seo: Tate Modern Prepares for London Olympics
headline.main: Tate Modern Prepares for the London Games
headline.print_headline: Tate Modern Prepares For the London Games
